[TableGen][DecoderEmitter] Improve conflicts dump

medium

This commit improves the way conflicts are dumped in TableGen's DecoderEmitter, specifically by adding a function to print bit values for each position with an optional BitWidth parameter. This change aims to provide clearer and more detailed information about decoding conflicts.

  • Add a new function `dumpBits`
  • Optional parameter `BitWidth` is introduced to limit the number of bits printed in one call to `dumpBits`
TableGenDecoderEmitterImprovementx86_64OtherslowLLVM

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/ea4325f174baca7d12e128db4f9f3b41a918da67

clang-format更新OneLineFormatOffRegex选项，修正getcpu标准及增强CI日志统计功能

high

在llvm项目中，进行了多处功能的更新和修复。主要包括以下几方面：1. 在clang-format中添加了OneLineFormatOffRegex选项来简化格式化的管理；2. 修正了libstdc++中的getcpu标准函数；3. CI系统新增了一个显示统计信息的功能；4. ADT模块在SmallPtrSetImpl::remove_if方法中使用small_buckets()。这些更改的目的是为了提高代码质量和维护性。

  • Inclang-format添加OneLineFormatOffRegex选项
  • 修正getcpu标准函数
  • 增强CI日志统计功能
  • ADT模块改进SmallPtrSetImpl::remove_if
CVE性能回归ABI/行为破坏重大发布/弃用跨平台破坏OtherslowLLVM

medium

A talk will be given at the LLVM US dev meeting about exploring the benefits of writing richer tablegen descriptions for operations, types, and attributes in MLIR. The speaker is seeking feedback on how to better utilize TableGen in this context.

clang[test] Location of Clang debug-info tests

medium

Currently the Clang debug-info tests are spread across a couple of directories and recently introduced for the KeyInstructions work. This discussion suggests centralizing where the debug-info tests are located, moving them under the clang/test/DebugInfo directory, or having CXX and ObjC subdirectories for language-specific debug-info generation.

  • Currently spread across multiple directories
  • Recently introduced for KeyInstructions work
  • Suggestions to centralize and categorize test locations
ClangDebugInfoTestLocationOthersBackend/TargetlowLLVM

MLIR GPU CUDA sm90 gemm_pred_f32_f16_f16_128x128x128.mlir integration test failure and matmul.py traceback

high

The author encountered issues when trying to start an integrated test for the nvgpu dialect in the MLIR project using CMake commands. They found that the llvm-lit command failed, reporting unsupported tests for MLIR :: Integration/GPU/CUDA/sm90/gemm_pred_f32_f16_f16_128x128x128.mlir. Additionally, running a Python script 'matmul.py' resulted in a traceback error.

  • CMake command used to build the MLIR project includes settings for CUDA and Python bindings
  • Failed to run llvm-lit on the test file gemm_pred_f32_f16_f16_128x128x128.mlir, reporting unsupported tests
  • Python script 'matmul.py' execution failed with a traceback error

Best design pattern for toggle full vs partial dialect conversion in MILR?

medium

A discussion on converting StableHLO into a custom dialect via either a full or partial conversion, with the need to handle illegal operations differently based on the mode.

  • full vs partial conversion
  • idiomatic design pattern
  • handle illegal operations differently
  • use applyFullConversion for full path, applyPatternsGreedily for partial path

Emit a warning when -fsanitize-trap=<...> is passed without associated -fsanitize=<...>

high

The discussion revolves around the Undefined Behavior Sanitizer (UBSan) flag -fsanitize-trap=, which enables trapping Undefined Behavior Sanitizer. The current behavior of silently ignoring -fsanitize-trap= when it appears on its own is proposed to be changed as it does not provide sufficient warnings.

  • inconsistent handling of flags
  • silent configuration inactivation
Undefined Behavior Sanitizer (UBSan)CVEperformance regressionToolchainhighLLVMOthersIR/Passx86_64Backend/Target

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-emit-a-warning-when-fsanitize-trap-is-passed-without-associated-fsanitize/87893

low

A series of RISC-V LLVM sync-up calls held on various dates in the past year, including August 14th 2025, April 24th 2025, June 19th 2025, May 22nd 2025, and July 17th 2025. These calls were typically agenda and dial-in information shared in the RISC-V LLVM Discussion Forums.

RFC: Support cheriot target triple as subarchitecture of riscv32

high

Following a broader RFC on upstreaming CHERI, there is discussion on adding support for the CHERIoT architecture in LLVM's target triple. CHERIoT is a full system architecture for a CHERI-based RISCV32E microcontroller, requiring more detailed discussion due to its unique characteristics and divergences from a RISCV32E + CHERI baseline.

  • Proposed addition of riscv32cheriotv1-unknown-unknown and riscv32cheriotv1-unknown-cheriotrtos triples to LLVM's target triple
  • Proposal includes parsing riscv32cheriot-... as an alias for riscv32cheriotv1-...
  • Detailed documentation of divergences from a RISCV32E + CHERI baseline, including instruction set extensions/restrictions, calling conventions changes, capability/permission formats alterations, source-level annotations exposure, relocation additions, and custom linkage model definition
RISC-VCHERITarget TripleRFCMicrocontroller ArchitecturehighLLVMOthersBackend/Target

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-support-cheriot-target-triple-as-subarchitecture-of-riscv32/87883

RFC: Extending Memory Effects and Improving Loop Invariant Code Motion via a New MemInit Effect

medium

A discussion on extending memory effects in LLVM's compiler infrastructure to improve loop invariant code motion (LICM). This proposal seeks to refine how the `MemWrite` effect is handled within operations, particularly addressing scenarios where there are no inputs and no read effects.

  • Proposing changes to handle cases with MemWrite without inputs or reads
  • Discussion on whether an operation can be considered independent of external influences in such cases
  • Seeking feedback on changing the expected handling of MemWrite for optimization purposes
LLVMCompiler InfrastructureLoop Invariant Code MotionMemory EffectsRFClowIR/Pass

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-extending-memory-effects-and-improving-loop-invariant-code-motion-via-a-new-meminit-effect/87873

PSA: Automatic Location Inference in Python

medium

The PSA mentions the introduction of automatic location inference capabilities in the LLVM/MLIR project for Python, allowing the inference of source locations within IR generated using Python bindings. This feature is enabled by default but can be disabled if not needed to reduce overhead. The feature can be activated through a provided API and provides detailed CallSiteLoc information for each function call in the callstack.

  • Automatic location inference in Python IR
  • Enabled by default, disableable to save overhead
  • Activatable using `globals.set_loc_tracebacks_enabled(True)`
  • Supports registering included/excluded filenames for file filtering
PSAAutomatic Location InferencePythonMLIRlowIR/PassLLVM

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/psa-automatic-location-inference-in-python/87871

Thread safety analysis and std::weak_ptr

medium

I'm adding Thread Safety Annotations to my project which uses std::weak_ptr and types like it, which doesn't support PT_GUARDED_BY because it lacks operator* and operator->. I'm seeking recommendations on how to annotate those types that need protection for accessing the underlying type via std::weak_ptr::lock().

  • std::weak_ptr does not support PT_GUARDED_BY
  • Operator* and operator-> are missing from std::weak_ptr
  • Discussion about using alias analysis or custom attribute (lock_returned(*this)) on std::weak_ptr::lock() for thread safety
Thread Safetystd::weak_ptrPT_GUARDED_BYalias analysishighLLVMOthersx86_64Backend/Target

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/thread-safety-analysis-and-std-weak-ptr/87864

Statically link libLLVM

medium

Hello all, I'm building a compiler using MLIR and CMake. My goal is to statically link all MLIR code into my library, but I’m running into issues. When I set -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=, CMake links MLIR statically into my library as expected. However, if I don’t set this path, CMake finds LLVM from the release or Homebrew, and my final library ends up depending on libLLVM.dylib instead.

  • Statically linking MLIR code into a library
  • Issue when CMake does not find the correct LLVM installation
  • Problem arises from -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH being unset
  • CMake finds LLVM from release/Homebrew, leading to dynamic linkage
CMakeMLIRStatic linkingLLVMDynamic linkageReleasemediumIR/Pass

RFC: Supporting Multiple TOSA Specification Versions

high

The dialect has recently been updated to support version 1.0 of the TOSA specification, guaranteeing backwards-compatibility between minor versions. The RFC aims to enable validation and generation of multiple minor versions of the TOSA specification within the TOSA dialect.

  • Support for validating content against different versions of the TOSA specification
  • Ability to convert content to an earlier version of the TOSA specification where possible
SafetyCVEABI/Behavior DestructionCross-Platform DamagemediumReleaseLLVMIR/PassBackend/Target

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-supporting-multiple-tosa-specification-versions/87810

RFC: Extending UniformQuantizedType with interface-based support for new storage types in Quant dialect

high

Currently, UniformQuantizedType only supports built-in MLIR storage types such as Integer. There is a growing need to make the system extensible and maintainable as more types are added. The proposed interface-based approach aims to define a StorageTypeInterface that specifies required methods any storage type must implement to be used in UniformQuantizedType, encapsulating their type-specific logic for better scalability and maintainability.

  • Current implementation relies on dynamic checks (e.g., type switches or if-else chains) to determine the storage type and retrieve type-specific information for legality checks.
  • The proposed interface-based approach defines a StorageTypeInterface with required methods that any storage type must implement to be used in UniformQuantizedType, encapsulating their type-specific logic.
  • This change ensures MLIR can natively support new types like NF4 through a clean, extensible interface and improves scalability and maintainability of the system.
MLIRUniformQuantizedTypeStorageTypeInterfaceNF4Quant dialecthighBackend/TargetIR/PassLLVM

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-extending-uniformquantizedtype-with-interface-based-support-for-new-storage-types-in-quant-dialect/87803

Dialect Attributes in MLIR C-API

high

An issue was encountered where some attributes of a dialect (ODS dialect) operations cannot be read or written through the MLIR C-API, particularly with ODS dialect ops. The specific problem involves the cond attribute of the sv.ifdef.procedural op.

  • Unable to read/write certain attributes (cond in this case) of ODS dialect ops through MLIR C-API
  • C API limitations lead to issues like Melior not working as intended
  • Concrete example provided in a GitHub repository demonstrating the issue
  • The cond attribute returns true for existence but null type and false for being an #sv attribute
MLIR C-APIODS dialectsv.ifdef.procedural opDialect attribute issuesRustIR/PassLLVMBackend/Targethigh

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/dialect-attributes-in-mlir-c-api/87800https://github.com/jgreenbaum/mlir-c-api-attribute-issue

Appease check-MAINTAINERS.py (email order)

high

This commit addresses an issue with the contrib/check-MAINTAINERS.py script which incorrectly orders contributions based on surname, name, bugzilla handle, and email in that sequence. The maintainer aims to correct this by documenting how entries are sorted and rearranging Andrew Pinski's entries under the DCO (Developer Certificate of Origin) section in the MAINTAINERS file.

  • Documentation needed for contrib/check-MAINTAINERS.py script
  • Reorder Andrew Pinski's entries in Contributing section under DCO in MAINTAINERS file

[PATCH] testsuite: Fix PR108080 testcase for some targets [PR121396]

medium

This patch aims to fix a test case in the GCC testsuite that relates to an issue identified with the 'gnu::optimize' or 'gnu::target' attributes. The patch is relevant when these attributes are present on a target node, and it corrects a temporary warning by making adjustments.

  • Fixing a test case for PR108080
  • Adjusting the warning related to unsupported attributes 'gnu::optimize' or 'gnu::target'
  • Tested on x86_64-pc-linux-gnu and powerpc64-linux-gnu cross

[PATCH 2/3] ira: tie output allocnos for fused instruction pairs

medium

This is a discussion thread about a patch related to improving instruction reordering (IRA) in the GCC compiler. The patch aims to ensure that output allocation numbers are tied for fused instruction pairs, which can affect how instructions are reordered during compilation.

  • Conceptually OK but with some concerns
  • Potential issues if PREV_INSN is used outside of the scheduler context
  • Use of prev_nonnote_nondebug_insn as a safer alternative due to potential problems with BB markers
gcccompilerIRApatchLinux KernelToolchainARM64RISC-VhighGCCOthersIR/Passx86_64Regression

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/e685c33c-9539-417f-b5c2-8b0ee979aa74@gmail.com/

IRA: Tie output allocnos for fused instruction pairs

medium

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/07a0baa7609a5a78d8b4a3c17897768fb2119605

  • Fused instruction pairs require that both components have the same hard register output for fusion in hardware.
  • Conditions (a)-(c) are encapsulated in the newly created predicate single_output_fused_pair_p().
  • During IRA, if conditions (a)-(c) hold, the two instructions' destination allocnos are tied together to allocate them to the same hard register.
GCCFusionInstruction PairRegister AllocationlowOthers

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/07a0baa7609a5a78d8b4a3c17897768fb2119605

RISC-V 编译器漏洞修复：扩展条件块匹配

high

GCC 编译器团队发布了一个补丁，解决了在 arch-canonicalize 中的条件块解析问题。此问题源于之前使用的简单正则表达式未能正确匹配包含多个代码块和闭合括号的条件块。

  • 修复了在 arch-canonicalize 中的条件块解析错误
  • 原始的简单正则表达式无法处理嵌套条件块及其闭合括号
  • 导致 'd' 和 'zcd' 被视为非条件依赖项，从而误导地添加到输出中
GCCRISC-V安全漏洞Othersx86_64lowBackend/Target

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/14b15a9a473fc69b0251e625c397e70c396f0c0chttps://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CA+yXCZBvnUS96jDDpm5AYAfO_MDXdbfzF5pRXPmyWcnhAaCFCg@mail.gmail.com/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250816130439.734251-1-dimitar@dinux.eu/

PATCH: x86: Place the TLS call before all FLAGS_REG setting BBs

high

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250817004804.3710369-1-hjl.tools@gmail.com/

  • TLS call cannot be placed before a conditional jump in a basic block
  • The TLS call will clobber the flags register if placed after FLAGS_REG setting BBs
  • Should place TLS call before all register setting basic blocks that dominate the current basic block
ABIBehavior destructionOthersGCCx86_64lowBackend/Target

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250817004804.3710369-1-hjl.tools@gmail.com/

GCC 编译器中的Unnamed Unscoped Enums 链接更改实现

medium

This commit introduces changes to the GCC compiler regarding unnamed unscoped enums, specifically addressing linkage issues by adding a bitwise OR operator between TYPE_UNNAMED_P and enum_with_enumerator_for_linkage_p.

  • Implementing P2115R0 linkage changes for unnamed unscoped enums in GCC
  • Adding a bitwise OR condition to check if the type is either an unnamed or has an enumerator for linkage
  • Potential impact on existing code that relies on the current implementation of TYPE_UNNAMED_P and enum_with_enumerator_for_linkage_p
GCCC++Undefined BehaviorABI ChangesOtherslowx86_64

fortran: Set DECL_TLS_MODEL after processing a variable

low

Several commits and PRs have been made to modify the behavior of setting the DECL_TLS_MODEL attribute in Fortran compiler. The changes aim to ensure that set_decl_tls_model is called only after a variable has been fully processed, not during its processing.

  • Call set_decl_tls_model only after a variable has been fully processed
  • Changes made in gcc/fortran/trans-common.cc and gcc/fortran/trans-decl.cc
  • A new test case added for PR fortran/107421 in gfortran.dg/gomp/pr107421.f90
lowGCCOthersx86_64Backend/Target

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/2e567a06555ac92105e6264fc219a2d5131e1b4ehttps://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250816190737.Xd57DQRINDDHOT6YcnZm@gmx.de/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/49313fc2-1ca0-41d5-839f-a3cd9569d771@gmx.de/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250816190737.Xd57DQRINDDHOT6YcnZS_YRD0gt3HYv9gsumWkBqU8w@z/

fortran: Set DECL_TLS_MODEL after processing a variable

low

Several commits and PRs have been made to modify the behavior of setting the DECL_TLS_MODEL attribute in Fortran compiler. The changes aim to ensure that set_decl_tls_model is called only after a variable has been fully processed, not during its processing.

  • Call set_decl_tls_model only after a variable has been fully processed
  • Changes made in gcc/fortran/trans-common.cc and gcc/fortran/trans-decl.cc
  • A new test case added for PR fortran/107421 in gfortran.dg/gomp/pr107421.f90
lowGCCOthersx86_64Backend/Target

c++: Fix ICE on mangling invalid compound requirement

high

This patch addresses a compiler issue causing an Internal Compiler Error (ICE) when handling invalid type-constraints in C++. The problem arises from the `write_requirement` function expecting a `TEMPLATE_TYPE_PARM`, which leads to failed assertions. To mitigate this, the trailing return type is set to NULL_TREE for invalid type-constraints, allowing some contexts to avoid redundant errors.

  • Fixes ICE caused by invalid type-constraint mangling
  • Prevents failed assertion in `write_requirement` function
  • Allows some invalid constraints to be satisfied in certain contexts
ICEGCClowOthersx86_64Backend/Target

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CAD+gk=hBM+j_ffw3E+2Fpm3JvvWBLsSrOhViNjXXoqLdF5UbxA@mail.gmail.com/

  • Removed extra copy in a testcase (pr120122-1.c)
  • Copied modified version of load instruction for handling boolean loads

Re: [PATCH] c++: Add testcases for the defarg part of P1766R1 [PR121552]

medium

This thread discusses adding test cases related to default arguments (defarg) in a C++ project. The discussion revolves around whether or not certain situations should be treated as errors, specifically regarding textual deduplication and ODR (Object Definition Rules). The main points of contention seem to be the interpretation of how different default argument definitions within different Translation Units (TUs) should be handled.

  • Discussion about whether certain situations involving default arguments in different TUs should result in errors or not
  • Concerns around textual deduplication and its impact on ODR rules
  • Need to determine the expected behavior of default argument definitions across different TU boundaries
C++default argumentsODR (Object Definition Rules)textual deduplicationGCCOtherslow

Re: [PATCH v2 1/3] AArch64: Support C/C++ operations on svbool_t

high

This patch series aims to support a subset of C/C++ operations such as bitwise, conditional, and others on the svbool_t type in AArch64 architecture. The changes include support for vector boolean types with new patterns added to the assembly file and modifications made in various parts of the compiler.

  • Support for vector boolean operations
  • New patterns defined for predicate modes
  • Modifications to existing functions such as `build_binary_op` and `cp_build_binary_op`
  • Changes to validation functions like `aarch64_valid_vector_boolean_op`, `aarch64_invalid_unary_op`, and `aarch64_invalid_binary_op`

PATCH: Improve locations for macros defined prior to PCH include

medium

A patch has been submitted to improve the location assignments of macros that are defined before including a Precompiled Header (PCH) in the libcpp codebase. The PR was originally about an Internal Compiler Error (ICE) in the linemap code that was resolved for GCC 14. This patch aims to handle macro definitions better, ensuring they remain distinct or identical from those in the PCH and are restored appropriately after loading.

  • Improvement of locations assignments for macros defined prior to PCH include
  • Handling of macros that might be defined before including a PCH
  • Restoration process similar to how command-line -D option is processed

Fix default argument parsing in non-comma variadic methods

medium

This PR aims to fix the default argument parsing issue within non-comma variadic functions/methods in GCC. These features were deprecated in C++26, but are still valid and remain valid without deprecation from C++98 to C++23. The main changes include handling ...) as not part of the default argument when at depth 0.

  • Fixes parsing issue for non-comma variadic methods
  • Validates these features in C++98 to C++23 despite deprecation in C++26
  • Handles CPP_ELLIPSIS followed by CPP_CLOSE_PAREN as not part of default argument at depth 0
GCCC++default argument parsingnon-comma variadic methodsC++ deprecationOthershighx86_64

RISC-V: fix __builtin_round clobbering FP exceptions flags

medium

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/f5696e9b1113b0a8e464cabb8cc26c871b1d9289

  • __builtin_round() fails to save/restore FP exception flags around the FP compare insn which can potentially clobber the same.
  • The fflags restore bracketing is slightly different between GCC and glibc implementations.
  • gcc generates code where FSFLAGS is placed AFTER a branch, before the label 'L3'.
  • glibc implementation avoids FFLAGS clobber due to early NaN check, allowing it to be moved under the branch.
ABIbehavior destructionRISC-VlowGCCOthersBackend/Target

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/f5696e9b1113b0a8e464cabb8cc26c871b1d9289

GCC 编译器中针对计数引用的 .ACCESS_WITH_SIZE 调用条件更改

medium

在 GCC 编译器的一个提交中，代码对 `handle_counted_by_for_component_ref` 和 `default_function_array_read_conversion` 函数进行了修改。改动在于检查是否为读取操作时才调用 `.ACCESS_WITH_SIZE` 方法。

  • .ACCESS_WITH_SIZE 调用条件更改
  • 在计数引用（counted_reference）中仅在读取操作时调用
GCC 编译器性能回归安全性改进GCCOtherslowx86_64

Clang vs GCC ffp-contract Defaults on Benchmarking Impact

medium

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/impact-of-ffp-contract-defaults-on-benchmarking/87906

  • - Clang defaults to ffp-contract=on for C/C++ by default, disabling fused multiply-add across statements.
  • - GCC defaults to ffp-contract=fast unless a standard C dialect is explicitly set via e.g. std=c11.
  • - The difference in dynamically executed instructions impacts SPEC CPU 2017 benchmarks significantly for applications like namd and lbm.
ClangGCCBenchmarkingffp-contractSPEC CPU 2017GPUOthersPerformanceLLVMBackend/Targetmedium

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/impact-of-ffp-contract-defaults-on-benchmarking/87906

Using GOTPCREL relocations for personality and typeinfo eh_frame references?

medium

A discussion on using GETPCREL relocations to handle personality and typeinfo eh_frame references in Clang. The discussion addresses potential issues with the indirect encoding of pointers, specifically that they are emitted under the .data section, which could lead to deduplication across compile units and being writable.

  • Issues with indirect encoding for personality and typeinfo pointers
  • Potential issues with deduplication and writeability
  • Proposed solution: Use GOTPCREL relocations instead of creating stubs

Swift compiler diagnostics when typechecking closures are not good

low

One Feature observing state of another (for MVVM implementation)

medium

A trivial question regarding the implementation of MVVM using TCA pattern. The user is struggling with getting notifications when the global state changes in a ViewModel, as they are using @SharedReader to access it.

Supporting Span in Packages

medium

As Swift approaches the release of Swift 6.2, information is provided on how to support Span in packages. The types include Span, RawSpan, MutableSpan, MutableRawSpan, OutputSpan, and OutputRawSpan with back-deployment support for Darwin-based platforms. However, there are restrictions both on the compiler and deployment due to limits on how far they can be back-deployed.

  • The Span family of types includes: Span, RawSpan, MutableSpan, MutableRawSpan, OutputSpan and OutputRawSpan
  • There is a limit to how far back the Span types can be back-deployed for Darwin-based platforms
  • Restrictions apply both on the compiler and deployment due to limitations in back-deployment capabilities
  • APIs using Span family of types must use Swift 6.2 compilers for non-stable ABI platforms like Linux, Windows, and embedded targets
SwiftBackdeploymentSpan family of typesDarwin-based platformsConditional compilationAvailability annotationsReleaseBackend/Targethigh

A discussion about the feasibility and challenges of adding a runtime class generation API in Swift, similar to what Objective-C has with `objc_allocateClassPair`.

  • Currently preventing Swift from having dynamic/runtime class generation api

  • Dynamic executable code generation is out of scope
  • Generic types' metatype pointers already need to be dynamically allocated at runtime through functions like `swift_allocateGenericClassMetadata()`

medium

  • @Redirected指令是否仅作为文档JSON的一部分存在，还是它能够扩展并创建现有档案库中的链接
  • 如果将一篇文章迁移到新的URL，并使用GitHub Pages托管，但在希望archive提供指向新位置的重定向来保留外部人员的旧链接时，这是否可行？

Optimization Controls and Optimization Hints

medium

https://forums.swift.org/t/optimization-controls-and-optimization-hints/81612

  • Static heuristics in Compilers recognize pattern in program structure such as loops, asserts, throwing an exception to judge execution frequency of code sections.
  • These static compiler heuristics are used to make trade-offs in code size vs optimization aggressiveness judgements.
  • Optimization controls and hints can be provided by programming languages to give more control over when optimizations should happen or to communicate properties useful for a compiler’s optimization heuristic.
  • Optimization controls guarantee an optimization happens regardless of possibly changing compiler heuristics between compiler versions, making them important tools for predictable code optimization.
SwiftCompilerOptimization ControlsHintsPredictabilityConsistencyReleasehighPerformanceBackend/Target

https://forums.swift.org/t/optimization-controls-and-optimization-hints/81612
